title: Reports center pane
content:
The Reports center pane displays the report selected in the Reports list.

The following options are available.

When exporting reports to a CSV or XLS file, the system exports certain fields at a minimum depending on the record type. For most record types, the system exports the ID and Display Label fields at a minimum, and some record types have more minimum fields other than these two.Â 
Element Description
Duplicate

Click Duplicate to create a new report based on an existing one. You can make changes to the new report in the New report dialog box. Both the original report and the new one are saved.

  • When duplicating an analytic or survey report, the new report is defined as active by default, even if the original report is inactive.
  • When duplicating a public report, the duplicated report is private.
Export CSV Click Export to export the grid report to a CSV file.
Export XLS Click Export to export the grid report to an XLSX file.
Export PDF Click Export to export the report to a PDF file.
Change type

Click Change type to change the type of a report. The original report isn't saved.

You can change a report from:

  • Operational to analytic. The report is defined as active and is counted toward the quota.
  • Analytic to operational. The report is no longer counted toward the quota.

If the requested change can't be made due to the selected report properties, an error message displays the relevant properties. Edit the properties and click Change type again.

This option isn't relevant for survey reports or operational raw data reports.
Activate/Deactivate

For analytic or survey reports, click Activate or Deactivate.

Active reports are counted toward the quota; inactive reports aren't counted.

  • This option isn't relevant for operational reports.
  • Out-of-the-box reports can't be edited but can be activated or deactivated.
Display

Select the option for displaying the report:

  • Chart . View the report as a chart.
  • Grid . View the report as a table.
Refresh Click Refresh to refresh the report.
<Drill down>

In a chart report, click a bar or a pie slice to drill down to the source data in the relevant module. In a stacked or grouped report, the drill down goes to the source data of the specific subgroup selected.

In a grid report, hover over a row of the grid and click the drill down icon at the left to drill down to the source data in the relevant module.

  • This option isn't relevant for survey reports.
  • At least one of the fields selected for the report filter or the grouping options must be a searchable field. Searchable fields are defined in the metadata for the record type.
  • If the source data for the selected bar or slice of a chart or grid row is greater than 4,000 rows of data, you can't drill down to it.
  • Drill down isn't available for reports based on articles, models, or Service Level targets.
  • In an analytic report, if the report is grouped by a time field by hour, you can't drill down to the source data.
  • In an analytic report, if the report is grouped by a time field, you can't drill down to the source data for the section representing a null value.
<Legend>

In Chart reports, the report legend displays a colored square for each item in the chart grouping.

You can dynamically modify the chart by clicking the squares to remove or replace the items in the chart.

The legend is hidden for charts with more than 20 groups.
